TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImageFormatConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: is a class that can be used to convert objects from one data type to another. Access this class through the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A type converter is used to convert values between data types. A type converter also supports property configuration at design time by providing text-to-value conversion or a list of values that users can select from. Access the <xref:System.Drawing.ImageFormatConverter> class through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class by calling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Drawing.ImageFormatConverter> converts to and from known image formats, as specified in the <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat> class.
> [!NOTE] > If you want to convert between image formats, such as converting between BMP and JPEG, use one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Image.Save%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> methods that takes an <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat> object as a parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Do not create a <xref:System.Drawing.ImageFormatConverter> object directly. Access the <xref:System.Drawing.ImageFormatConverter> class through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class by calling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.ImageFormatConverter> converts to and from known image formats, as specified in the <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat> class.
The most common type conversion is to and from a string type. The default implementation calls the <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> method of the object if the object is valid and if the destination type is `string`. If this method cannot convert the specified object to the specified destination type, it throws a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection that contains a set of standard values for the data type this validator is designed for. Returns if the data type does not support a standard set of values.
Docs.returns: A collection that contains a standard set of valid values, or . The default implementation always returns .
